text_blocks.snippet: Free and low-cost counselling in North Vancouver is available through Family Services of the North Shore (up to 6 free sessions), Foundry North Shore for youth (12-24), and the Canadian Mental Health Association. Immediate, free support is available 24/7 by calling 310-6789 or 9-8-8, and virtual options are provided via Reach Medical Clinic.
Top Free/Low-Cost Counselling Services in North Vancouver

list.snippet: Family Services of the North Shore: Offers, no-fee, low-fee, and sliding scale ($30-$125) services, including up to 6 free sessions for COVID-19-related stressors. Contact: 604-988-5281 or email intake@familyservices.bc.ca.
Foundry North Shore: Provides free, confidential, in-person and virtual drop-in counselling for youth aged 12 to 24 and their families.
Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) - North and West Vancouver: Offers short-term, low-cost, confidential, one-to-one support for adults.
Peer Assisted Care Team (PACT): A mental health,, community-led, trauma-informed response for the North Shore, available 8 am – 12:30 am, 7 days a week, at 1-888-261-7228.
Reach Medical Clinic: Offers free virtual counselling sessions covered by MSP.
Parkgate Community Services Society: Provides community-based counseling services.
BC Crisis Line: 310-6789 (no area code needed).
988 Suicide Crisis Helpline: Call or text 988.
Here to Help BC: Provides resources to find low-cost or free services across the province.
HealthLink BC: Dial 8-1-1 to find mental health resources.
